qas.question: What's the name of the wall tower that was the first of its kind in England built for artillery purposes?
In what year was the God's House Tower built?
What museum was located in God's House Tower until 2011?
Which king of England directed new fortifications that helped Southampton rely less on its wall?
In what century did Southampton complete construction of the wall around the city?

context: The city walls include <a0_0>God's House Tower<a0_0/>, built in <a1_0>1417<a1_0/>, the first purpose-built artillery fortification in England. Over the years it has been used as home to the city's gunner, the Town Gaol and even as storage for the Southampton Harbour Board. Until September 2011, it housed the <a2_0>Museum of Archaeology<a2_0/>. The walls were completed in the <a4_0>15th<a4_0/> century, but later development of several new fortifications along Southampton Water and the Solent by <a3_0>Henry VIII<a3_0/> meant that Southampton was no longer dependent upon its fortifications.
